meanings.definition: A written record or communication, as in a note or letter.
meanings.sent1: I always keep important memorandums in my desk drawer.
meanings.sent2: The office manager sent out memorandums to all employees regarding the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The memorandums on the bulletin board were so funny that they made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed onto the page like a river of memorandums.
meanings.sent5: The memorandums from the meeting were etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: A document outlining the terms of an agreement or understanding.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer drafted the memorandums for the business deal.
meanings.sent2: The memorandums of the contract were signed by both parties.
meanings.sent3: The memorandums were so detailed that they looked like a map of rules.
meanings.sent4: The memorandums of the treaty were as clear as crystal.
meanings.sent5: The memorandums of the negotiation were crucial for the success of the deal.

meanings.definition: A brief written summary or reminder.
meanings.sent1: She quickly jotted down the memorandums of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out memorandums to help students study for the test.
meanings.sent3: The memorandums on the fridge reminded them of the grocery list.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a filing cabinet of memorandums, neatly organized.
meanings.sent5: The memorandums of the speech were concise and to the point.
